comments: a(5n+1) == 4 modulo 10.The product of any k consecutive integers is divisible by the sum of the same k integers for odd nonprime k's: 1 (trivial case), 9 (this sequence), 15, etc. - _Zak Seidov_, Mar 18 2014
links: T. D. Noe, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..1000
formula: a(-n) = a(n-8) for all n in Z. - _Michael Somos_, Mar 18 2014a(n) = 64 * A104678(n-1) = 64 * binomial(n+3, 4) * binomial(n+8, 4). - _Michael Somos_, Mar 18 2014
mathematica: nn = 9; Table[c = Range[n, n + nn - 1]; Times @@ c/Total[c], {n, 0, 25}] (* _T. D. Noe_, Mar 18 2014 *)
prog: (PARI) a(n) = prod(i=0, 8, n+i)/sum(i=0, 8, n+i); \\ _Michel Marcus_, Mar 18 2014
author: _Patrick De Geest_, May 15 1998
extensions: Typo in name fixed by _Zak Seidov_, Mar 18 2014
